name: Hotel Les Bains de Camargue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is right on beach at end of marina road. So car is essential for getting around, but you need a car anyway in this part of France - it's not the Côte d'Azur with its excellent public transport.
reviews.title: Very comfortable mid-range beach hotel with spa

likes.liked: — Did everything to a good standard of comfort - everythig worked fine!

reviews.text: One unusual aspect of the design of the hotel was the balcony / room size. Previous reviewer said the "the rooms were small" - of course, this opinion is relative, but if you look at photos of the hotel the balcony is small. However, the rooms go off at an angle to the balcony, giving, what was to us, a normal European sized room. The design objective is to give most of the hotel's rooms a sea view. A good, practical design, but it doesn't do the hotel any favours in the brochure.
reviews.title: Great service, very good food, but very poor rooms

likes.liked: — Friendly staff and sunday night diner

description: Located 4 km from the centre of Le Grau du Roi looking across to the largest beach in the Camargue. The hotel features a restaurant and bar with panoramic views, meeting rooms, beauty salon, a shop and direct access to the thalassotherapy institute. A charge applies to access the fitness area after 6 p.m.
